item.title: league to assume day-to-day control of dodgers
item.description: major league baseball (mlb), in an extraordinary move, plans to take control of the day-to-day operations of the los angeles dodgers because of mounting concern over the franchise's financial plight.

item.description: jhonas enroth, subbing for the injured ryan miller, shut out the rangers, who fell from seventh to eighth in the eastern conference.

item.title: indian court sends ex-games chief into police custody

item.description: american companies in march sold the most goods and services overseas since 1992, but rising oil prices increased the trade deficit 6 percent.

item.description: here's some more fantastic time-lapse video from terje sorgjerd of sweden. it's a stunning combination of meteorology and astronomy.

item.description: an index of prices in 20 cities is down 33.1 percent from the peak in july 2006 after falling for the eighth straight month in march.

item.title: china tightens grip on inner mongolia before planned

item.description: jeremy lamb scored just 12 points in connecticut's 53-41 victory over butler in the ncaa basketball championship game monday but he was at his best when it mattered most.

item.description: amar'e stoudemire missed the game with an injury, but chauncey billups eased concerns about an injury of his own in the win over the nets.

item.title: cancer cause or crop aid? herbicide faces big test
